com.hazelcast.internal.nearcache.impl.invalidation

Class Invalidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.nearcache.impl.invalidation.Invalidator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchInvalidator, NonStopInvalidator

    public abstract class Invalidator
extends Object
    Contains shared functionality for Near Cache invalidation.

      • invalidateKey

        public final void invalidateKey(Data key,
                                String dataStructureName,
                                String sourceUuid)
        Invalidates supplied key from Near Caches of supplied data structure name.
        Parameters:
        key - key of the entry to be removed from Near Cache
        dataStructureName - name of the data structure to be invalidated

      • invalidateAllKeys

        public final void invalidateAllKeys(String dataStructureName,
                                    String sourceUuid)
        Invalidates all keys from Near Caches of supplied data structure name.
        Parameters:
        dataStructureName - name of the data structure to be cleared

      • destroy

        public void destroy(String dataStructureName,
                    String sourceUuid)
        Removes supplied data structures invalidation queues and flushes their content. This method is called when removing a Near Cache for example with MapRemoteService.destroyDistributedObject(String)
        Parameters:
        dataStructureName - name of the data structure.
        See Also:
        MapRemoteService.destroyDistributedObject(String)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this invalidator back to its initial state. Aimed to call with ManagedService.reset()
        See Also:
        ManagedService.reset()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down this invalidator and releases used resources. Aimed to call with ManagedService.shutdown(boolean)
        See Also:
        ManagedService.shutdown(boolean)
